Philip Verbancsics and I are pleased to announce our new paper to appear in=
 GECCO 2011, "Constraining Connectivity to Encourage Modularity in HyperNEA=
T."

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/verbancsics_gecco11.pdf

Abstract: 
htt=
p://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publications/2011/verbancsics.gecco11.html

This paper=
 is of practical interest to HyperNEAT users because it in effect exposes a=
 potential flaw in part of the original design of HyperNEAT and fixes it wi=
th a simple change.  The flaw is in the way that HyperNEAT decides whether =
or not to express a connection based on a threshold that is compared to the=
 output of the CPPN that determines connection weights.  It turns out that =
conflating "whether to express" with "what is the weight" was making it har=
d for HyperNEAT to express certain kinds of patterns, in particular those t=
hat exhibit modular groupings in the network geometry.  This paper separate=
s these concepts into separate CPPN outputs and thereby exhibits a dramatic=
 improvement in the ability to consistently evolve separations in domain th=
at benefits from such separations, which may turn out useful in a variety o=
f domains.
